zh: 一位老人突然跟我说话。

en: The old person suddenly started talking to me.
zh: 那位老人突然开始跟我说话。

en: An old man sat surrounded by his grandchildren.
zh: 一位老人坐在他的孙子孙女们中间。

en: It is important for old people to stay strong.
zh: 对老年人来说，保持强壮很重要。

en: The old man was run over by a car.
zh: 那位老人被汽车撞倒了。

en: It is hard for an old man to change his way of thinking.
zh: 老人很难改变他的思维方式。

en: The old man was plodding along.
zh: 那老人步履蹒跚地走着。

en: An old man came tottering along.
zh: 一个老人蹒跚地走过来。

en: The old woman studied the visitor carefully.
zh: 老妇人仔细地打量着来访者。

en: I want to live comfortably when I become old.
zh: 我希望老了以后能过上舒适的生活。

en: If you want security in your old age, begin saving now.
zh: 如果你想晚年有保障，现在就开始存钱。

en: I'm saving money for my old age.
zh: 我正在为我的晚年存钱。

en: I will save up money for when I'm old.
zh: 我会存钱以备老年之用。

en: Conscientiously save money for one's old age.
zh: 认真地为自己的晚年存钱。

en: Everybody thinks that they are ready for their old age.
zh: 每个人都认为他们已经为他们的晚年做好了准备。

en: This is a condition caused by aging.
zh: 这是一种由衰老引起的疾病。

en: I'm getting farsighted as I get older.
zh: 随着年龄的增长，我开始老花眼了。

en: Young and old went to battle.
zh: 老少都去战斗了。

en: You have to get more exercise in order to stave off senility.
zh: 你必须多做运动，以防止老年痴呆。

en: Both young and old, men and women, regularly get together at the local bathhouses.
zh: 无论老少，无论男女，都经常在当地的澡堂聚会。

en: As they grow old, many people become unable to look after themselves.
zh: 随着年龄的增长，许多人变得无法照顾自己。

en: You must think of your old parents at home.
zh: 你要想着家里的老父母。

en: To my dismay I found I had lost my money.
zh: 令我沮丧的是，我发现我丢了钱。

en: Talk of the wolf and behold his skin.
zh: 说曹操，曹操到。

en: Can you tell wolves from dogs?
zh: 你能分辨狼和狗吗？

en: Flatterers look like friends, as wolves like dogs.
zh: 奉承者看起来像朋友，就像狼喜欢狗一样。

en: The leak needs to be stopped immediately.
zh: 必须立即止住漏水。

en: Waste makes want.
zh: 浪费导致匮乏。

en: It is not wise, nor in the long run is it kind, to tax the thrifty for the thriftless.
zh: 对节俭的人征税来补贴不节俭的人，既不明智，从长远来看也不仁慈。

en: The corridor was so crowded that we couldn't walk.
zh: 走廊太拥挤了，我们无法行走。

en: Watch your step, as the passageway is slippery.
zh: 小心脚下，通道很滑。

en: The hallway is slippery, so watch your step.
zh: 走廊很滑，所以小心脚下。

en: There's a fire down the hall.
zh: 大厅尽头着火了。

en: The emerging labor shortage is viewed as a sign of economic overheating.
zh: 新兴的劳动力短缺被视为经济过热的迹象。

en: The disagreement between the union and management could lead to a strike.
zh: 工会和管理层之间的分歧可能导致罢工。

en: The number of days lost through industrial dispute is shown in the table on the facing page.
zh: 因劳资纠纷而损失的工作日数显示在对面页面的表格中。

en: The labor union is negotiating with the owners.
zh: 工会正在与业主谈判。

en: The labor union called a strike.
zh: 工会号召罢工。

en: The labor union announced a strike.
zh: 工会宣布罢工。

en: The workers union called off their 24-hour strike today.
zh: 工人联盟今天取消了24小时的罢工。

en: The union bosses are fighting the freeze on wage hikes.
zh: 工会领导正在反对冻结工资上涨。

en: They want to better their working conditions.
zh: 他们想改善他们的工作条件。

en: The workers asked for an increase in pay.
zh: 工人们要求增加工资。

en: There has been an explosive increase in the demand for labor.
zh: 对劳动力的需求出现了爆炸性增长。

en: Workers made loud demands for higher wages.
zh: 工人们大声要求提高工资。

en: The workers came to ask about their pay raises.
zh: 工人们前来询问有关他们涨工资的事情。

en: Laborers required raising of a salary of the manager.
zh: 工人们要求提高经理的工资。

en: The workers are on strike.
zh: 工人们正在罢工。

en: The workers demanded that they talk with the owner.
zh: 工人们要求和老板谈话。

en: The workers' demands centered around overtime pay.
zh: 工人们的要求主要集中在加班费上。

en: Respect is due to the proletariat.
zh: 无产阶级应该受到尊重。

en: The laborers are murmuring against their working conditions.
zh: 工人们正在抱怨他们的工作条件。

en: The workers are complaining about their working conditions.
zh: 工人们正在抱怨他们的工作条件。

en: No workers can be dismissed without previous notice.
zh: 没有事先通知，任何工人都不能被解雇。

en: The workers demanded more money and holidays.
zh: 工人们要求更多的钱和假期。

en: The workman, as a rule, works eight hours a day.
zh: 一般来说，工人每天工作八小时。

en: Laborers normally work 8 hours per day.
zh: 工人们通常每天工作8小时。

en: The workers were laid off for three weeks.
zh: 工人们被解雇了三个星期。

en: The laborer was layed off for 3 weeks.
zh: 这名工人被解雇了3个星期。

en: The laborers were layed off for 3 weeks.
zh: 这些工人被解雇了3个星期。

en: Workers can go on strike for higher wages, or for better working conditions.
zh: 工人们可以为了更高的工资或更好的工作条件而罢工。

en: Most workers belong to unions.
zh: 大多数工人属于工会。

en: Many of the workers died of hunger.
zh: 许多工人死于饥饿。

en: A working man should be paid in proportion to his skill, not his age.
zh: 一个工人应该根据他的技能而不是年龄来支付工资。

en: The workers pushed for a raise in salary.
zh: 工人们争取加薪。

en: The workers united to demand higher wages.
zh: 工人们团结起来要求提高工资。

en: Workers put up with silly rules for a long time.
zh: 工人们长期以来一直忍受着愚蠢的规则。

en: The laborers formed a human barricade.
zh: 工人们组成了一道人墙。

en: The workers took pride in their work.
zh: 工人们以他们的工作为荣。

en: The workers were proud of their work.
zh: 工人们对他们的工作感到自豪。

en: The workers were naked to the waist.
zh: 工人们赤裸着上身。

en: The workers like to gather in a pub where they can let their hair down.
zh: 工人们喜欢聚集在酒吧里，在那里他们可以放松身心。

en: It stands to reason that workers are paid.
zh: 工人获得报酬是理所当然的。

en: The workers have no incentive to work harder.
zh: 工人们没有更努力工作的动力。

en: In labor negotiation union leaders play an important role.
zh: 在劳资谈判中，工会领导人扮演着重要的角色。

en: Work is a very important part of life in the United States.
zh: 工作是美国生活中非常重要的一部分。

en: Work is not only important for economic benefits, the salary, but also for social and psychological needs, the feeling of doing something for the good of society.
zh: 工作不仅对经济利益（工资）很重要，而且对社会和心理需求（为社会做好事的感觉）也很重要。

en: Labor is not merely a necessity but a pleasure.
zh: 劳动不仅仅是一种必需品，更是一种乐趣。

en: Our competitive position is weakened by the rising labor cost.
zh: 不断上涨的劳动力成本削弱了我们的竞争地位。

en: Industrial disputes are still a problem.
zh: 劳资纠纷仍然是一个问题。

en: The talk between labor and management yielded no definite results.
zh: 劳资双方的谈判没有取得明确的结果。

en: The dew evaporated when the sun rose.
zh: 太阳升起时，露水蒸发了。

en: The dew is on the leaves of grass.
zh: 草叶上挂着露珠。

en: Streetcars run on electricity.
zh: 有轨电车靠电力运行。

en: The streetcar is now certainly out of date.
zh: 有轨电车现在肯定过时了。

en: Can I get a route map, please?
zh: 请问能给我一张线路图吗？

en: Can I change the route?
zh: 我可以更改路线吗？

en: The blood on the road must be mine.
zh: 路上的血一定是我的。

en: There are lumps of snow lying on the road.
zh: 路上有成堆的积雪。

en: The snow on the road was in the way of the traffic.
zh: 路上的积雪妨碍了交通。

en: Keep in touch.
zh: 保持联系。

en: Keep in touch!
zh: 保持联系！

en: Please write down your contact address here.
zh: 请在这里写下您的联系地址。

en: Please write your contact address here.
zh: 请在这里填写您的联系地址。

en: How can I get in touch with you?
zh: 我怎么能联系到你？

en: When you contact me, please do so by phone.
zh: 你联系我的时候，请通过电话。

en: The reason for my silence is there was nothing special to write about.
zh: 我沉默的原因是没有什么特别的事情可以写。

en: Keep in touch, please.
zh: 请保持联系。

en: The federal budget was narrowly approved by Congress.
zh: 联邦预算以微弱优势获得国会批准。

en: Federal budget cuts will take a bite out of Social Security benefits.
zh: 联邦预算削减将会影响社会保障福利。

en: The Federal Reserve cut its benchmark discount rate to an 18-year low.
zh: 美联储将其基准贴现率降至18年来的最低水平。

en: The FTC nailed down new evidence in the fraud investigation.
zh: 联邦贸易委员会在欺诈调查中获得了新的证据。

en: I am sure that more flags were burned as a result of Congress passing that law than had ever been burned before.
zh: 我相信，由于国会通过了那项法律，焚烧的国旗比以往任何时候都多。

en: Traffic accidents happen daily.
zh: 交通事故每天都在发生。

en: The gang knocked him down and robbed him of his watch.
zh: 那伙人把他打倒并抢走了他的手表。

en: Everybody's business is nobody's business.
zh: 人人都管的事，反而没人管。

en: Collective responsibility means irresponsibility.
zh: 集体负责制意味着无人负责。

en: How long have they been playing tennis?
zh: 他们打网球多久了？

en: Thanks for bringing me here.
zh: 谢谢你带我来这里。

en: The lotus blossoms diffused an inexpressibly pleasant scent.
zh: 荷花散发出一种难以形容的香味。

en: Practice makes perfect.
zh: 熟能生巧。

en: Practice is the only way to master foreign languages.
zh: 练习是掌握外语的唯一途径。

en: However hard the training was, she never cried.
zh: 无论训练多么艰苦，她从未哭过。

en: No matter how hard the training was, she never cried.
zh: 无论训练多么艰苦，她从未哭过。

en: The bricklayer calculated that he would need 500 bricks for the wall.
zh: 瓦工计算出他需要500块砖才能砌好这堵墙。

en: Bricks consist mostly of clay.
zh: 砖主要由粘土组成。

en: One can't see through a brick wall.
zh: 人们无法看穿砖墙。

en: The lovers roamed around the fields in search of wild berries.
zh: 恋人们在田野里漫步，寻找野莓。

en: The lovers kissed.
zh: 恋人们亲吻了。

en: Lover, come back to me.
zh: 爱人，回到我身边吧。

en: She was very agitated at the news of her lover's death.
zh: 得知爱人去世的消息，她非常激动。

en: She was agitated by the news of her lover's death.
zh: 得知爱人去世的消息，她感到很不安。

en: The lovers engraved the oak tree with their initials.
zh: 恋人们在橡树上刻下了他们的姓名首字母。

en: The couple carved their initials into the oak tree.
zh: 这对情侣在橡树上刻下了他们的姓名首字母。

en: The couple carved their initials in an oak tree.
zh: 这对情侣在一棵橡树上刻下了他们的姓名首字母。

en: The couples carved their initials in oak trees.
zh: 情侣们在橡树上刻下了他们的姓名首字母。

en: The lovers were walking arm in arm.
zh: 恋人们手挽着手走着。

en: Love is beyond reason.
zh: 爱情是超越理性的。

en: Love is like the measles; we all have to go through it.
zh: 爱情就像麻疹；我们都必须经历它。

en: Love is like the measles. We all have to go through it.
zh: 爱情就像麻疹。我们都必须经历它。

en: Love is like measles - everyone should experience it.
zh: 爱情就像麻疹——每个人都应该体验它。

en: Falling in love is one thing; getting married is another.
zh: 坠入爱河是一回事；结婚是另一回事。

en: All's fair in love and war.
zh: 恋爱和战争中不择手段。

en: Love is blind. Hatred is also blind.
zh: 爱情是盲目的。仇恨也是盲目的。

en: Love is blind.
zh: 爱情是盲目的。

en: Love is a sickness full of woes, All remedies refusing.
zh: 爱情是一种充满悲伤的疾病，拒绝所有治疗。

en: Love, being jealous, makes a good eye look asquint.
zh: 爱情是善妒的，会使一双好眼睛斜视。

en: A man has free choice to begin love, but not to end it.
zh: 一个人有自由选择开始爱，但没有自由选择结束爱。

en: People can begin to love when they choose, but they have no choice when it comes to ending love.
zh: 人们可以选择开始爱，但在结束爱情时却别无选择。

en: People can choose to start loving, but can't choose to stop.
zh: 人们可以选择开始爱，但不能选择停止。

en: People can easily start loving, but not so easily stop.
zh: 人们可以很容易地开始爱，但不容易停止。

en: The taste of love is bitter.
zh: 爱情的滋味是苦涩的。

en: It is said that the taste of love is bitter.
zh: 据说爱情的滋味是苦涩的。

en: Pains of love be sweeter far / Than all other pleasures are.
zh: 爱情的痛苦远比其他快乐更甜蜜。

en: The pain you go through because of love is by far sweeter than any other pleasure.
zh: 因为爱情而经历的痛苦远比任何其他快乐更甜蜜。

en: The pain caused by love is much sweeter than any pleasure.
zh: 爱情带来的痛苦比任何快乐都更甜蜜。

en: Love and cough cannot be hidden.
zh: 爱情和咳嗽是隐藏不了的。

en: All is fair in love and war.
zh: 恋爱和战争中不择手段。

en: I'm looking for someone to fall in love with.
zh: 我在寻找一个可以坠入爱河的人。

en: Is this love?
zh: 这是爱吗？

en: I wonder if this is love.
zh: 我想知道这是不是爱。

en: Inferiority complex - what exactly does that mean?
zh: 自卑情结——到底是什么意思？

en: Smoking is banned in the train.
zh: 火车上禁止吸烟。

en: Smoking is prohibited on the train.
zh: 火车上禁止吸烟。

en: Smoking is not permitted on the train.
zh: 火车上不允许吸烟。

en: Smoking isn't permitted on the train.
zh: 火车上不允许吸烟。

en: On getting off the train, he was met by his cousin.
zh: 一下火车，他就见到了他的表弟。

en: As soon as he got off the train, he was met by his cousin.
zh: 他一下火车，就见到了他的表弟。

en: This train runs nonstop to Nagoya.
zh: 这趟火车直达名古屋。

en: The train was full, so she was obliged to travel second-class, and had to stand all the way.
zh: 火车很拥挤，所以她不得不坐二等车，而且一路站着。

en: The train left before they got to the station.
zh: 火车在他们到达车站之前就离开了。

en: It seems unlikely that the train will arrive on time.
zh: 火车似乎不太可能准时到达。

en: The train pulled out on time.
zh: 火车准时驶出。

en: The train left on time.
zh: 火车准时出发了。

en: The trains are running behind time.
zh: 火车晚点了。

en: Trains were arriving on time.
zh: 火车正点到达。

en: The train got in on time.
zh: 火车准时到达。

en: The train arrived at the station on time.
zh: 火车准时到达车站。

en: The train approached the town.
zh: 火车驶近了城镇。

en: The train will probably arrive at the station before noon.
zh: 火车大概会在中午之前到达车站。

en: The train ran off the tracks.
zh: 火车脱轨了。

en: The train was delayed by a heavy snowfall.
zh: 火车因大雪而延误了。

en: The train arrived at Osaka station.
zh: 火车到达了大阪站。

en: The train didn't wait for me.
zh: 火车没有等我。

en: The train was delayed by snow.
zh: 火车因雪而延误了。

en: The train was delayed because of snow.
zh: 火车因为下雪而延误了。

en: Do the trains run on diesel oil?
zh: 火车是用柴油发动的吗？

en: The train was hurrying west.
zh: 火车正赶往西部。

en: The train is due at noon.
zh: 火车预计中午到达。

en: The train gained speed gradually.
zh: 火车逐渐加速。

en: The train was full of passengers.
zh: 火车上挤满了乘客。

en: The train was about to leave.
zh: 火车就要开了。

en: The train just left.
zh: 火车刚开走。

en: The train arrived ten minutes behind time.
zh: 火车晚点十分钟到达。

en: Will the train leave on time?
zh: 火车会准时出发吗？

en: The train arrived on time, so we didn't have to wait at all.
zh: 火车准时到达，所以我们根本不用等。

en: The train was held up because of the railroad accident.
zh: 火车因铁路事故而延误了。

en: The train was late because of an accident.
zh: 火车因为事故晚点了。

en: The train was delayed because of an accident.
zh: 火车因为事故延误了。

en: The train is ten minutes behind today.
zh: 今天的火车晚点十分钟。

en: The train leaves at one-thirty this afternoon.
zh: 火车今天下午一点半出发。

en: The train has just arrived here.
zh: 火车刚刚到达这里。

en: The train has just gone.
zh: 火车刚刚开走。

en: The train was delayed two hours owing to the heavy snow.
zh: 因为大雪，火车晚点了两个小时。

en: The train was delayed for two hours because of the heavy snow.
zh: 因为大雪，火车延误了两个小时。

en: The train leaves at 2:30 p.m.
zh: 火车下午两点半发车。

en: The train left at five o'clock to the minute.
zh: 火车五点整离开了。

en: The train left at exactly five o'clock.
zh: 火车正好五点离开了。

en: The train leaves at nine, arriving there at ten.
zh: 火车九点出发，十点到达那里。

en: The train rolled out of the station.
zh: 火车驶出了车站。

en: The train came to a smooth stop.
zh: 火车平稳地停了下来。

en: The train gathered speed.
zh: 火车加速了。

en: I will check what time the train arrives.
zh: 我会查一下火车几点到达。

en: What time does the train reach Osaka?
zh: 火车几点到达大阪？

en: The train was clear of the station.
zh: 火车驶离了车站。

en: Would you tell me what time the train starts?
zh: 请问火车几点出发？

en: The train was seen to come into the station by me.
zh: 我看到火车进站了。

en: The train pulled into the station.
zh: 火车驶入了车站。

en: The train ran at the rate of 500 miles an hour.
zh: 火车以每小时500英里的速度行驶。

en: The train was going 500 miles per hour.
zh: 火车当时的时速是500英里。

en: The train was moving at 500 miles per hour.
zh: 火车当时以每小时500英里的速度行驶。

en: The train got into London.
zh: 火车到达伦敦了。

en: The train arrived in London.
zh: 火车到达伦敦了。

en: The train finally arrived.
zh: 火车终于到了。

en: The train has arrived here now.
zh: 火车现在已经到达这里了。

en: The train made a brief stop.
zh: 火车短暂地停了一下。

en: The train was almost an hour behind time.
zh: 火车晚了差不多一个小时。

en: The train was so crowded that I had to keep standing all the way.
zh: 火车太拥挤了，我不得不一路站着。

en: The train was so crowded that I had to stand all the way to Ueno.
zh: 火车太挤了，我不得不一直站到上野。

en: The train was very crowded so I had to stand all the way to Ueno.
zh: 火车非常拥挤，所以我不得不一直站到上野。

en: Since the train was very crowded, I had to stand all the way to Ueno.
zh: 因为火车非常拥挤，我不得不一直站到上野。

en: The weather got cold.
zh: 天气变冷了。

en: It was nice and cool there.
zh: 那里非常凉爽。

en: It was nice and cool, but it is getting cold now.
zh: 那里非常凉爽，但是现在开始变冷了。

en: Do you like a cool summer?
zh: 你喜欢凉爽的夏天吗？

en: Beams bear the weight of the roof.
zh: 梁支撑着屋顶的重量。

en: I want to buy cooking utensils in one lot.
zh: 我想一次性买齐烹饪用具。

en: Please tell the chef it was delicious.
zh: 请告诉厨师，饭菜很美味。

en: Too many cooks spoil the broth.
zh: 人多手杂，反而把事情办坏。

en: Please help me cook.
zh: 请帮我做饭。

en: Please help me prepare the food.
zh: 请帮我准备食物。

en: I'm a good cook.
zh: 我擅长烹饪。

en: I cook well.
zh: 我做饭很好吃。

en: I'm good at cooking.
zh: 我擅长做饭。

en: The dishes were not so delicious, but otherwise the party was a success.
zh: 菜肴不是那么美味，但除此之外，聚会很成功。

en: The food wasn't very delicious, but otherwise the party was a success.
zh: 食物不是很好吃，但除此之外，聚会很成功。

en: I learned cooking under my sister's tuition.
zh: 我跟姐姐学的做饭。

en: Jane told us that cooking was not difficult.
zh: 简告诉我们做饭不难。

en: The girl reading a cookbook is Kate.
zh: 那个正在看食谱的女孩是凯特。

en: Following a cookbook, I made my first Spanish food, and it came out very well.
zh: 按照食谱，我做了我的第一道西班牙菜，而且做得非常好。

en: Could you show me what you're serving?
zh: 你能给我看看你做的菜吗？

en: I don't know how to cook.
zh: 我不会做饭。

en: I don't know how to cook too many things.
zh: 我不太会做饭。

en: When it comes to cooking, no one can beat me.
zh: 说到做饭，没人能比过我。

en: A good cook doesn't throw out yesterday's soup.
zh: 一个好的厨师不会倒掉昨天的汤。

en: We need a woman able in cooking.
zh: 我们需要一个擅长烹饪的女人。

en: We want a woman who's good at cooking.
zh: 我们想要一个擅长烹饪的女人。

en: Do you have any questions about the menu?
zh: 你对菜单有什么问题吗？

en: Do you have any questions about the food?
zh: 你对食物有什么问题吗？

en: She is an expert when it comes to cooking.
zh: 她是个烹饪专家。

en: Cooking takes up too much time.
zh: 做饭太花时间了。

en: Cooking takes too much time.
zh: 做饭太花时间了。

en: When it comes to cooking, you cannot beat Mary.
zh: 说到做饭，你比不过玛丽。

en: In cooking we cannot hold a candle to the Chinese.
zh: 在烹饪方面，我们无法与中国人相提并论。

en: When it comes to cooking, no one can equal Mary.
zh: 说到做饭，没人能比得上玛丽。

en: I am no match for her in cooking.
zh: 我做饭不如她。

en: Draw a chicken before cooking.
zh: 烹饪前先画一只鸡。

en: Remove the chicken's giblets before cooking.
zh: 烹饪前取出鸡的内脏。

en: Cooking is interesting.
zh: 做饭很有趣。

en: At the sight of cooked snails, Jane turned pale.
zh: 简一看到煮熟的蜗牛就脸色苍白。

en: The food is cold.
zh: 食物是冷的。

en: Are you good at cooking?
zh: 你擅长做饭吗？

en: You are a good cook.
zh: 你是个好厨师。

en: Have you learned cooking or anything?
zh: 你学过烹饪之类的吗？

en: Have you studied cooking or something?
zh: 你研究过烹饪之类的吗？

en: The food was so good that I ate too much.
zh: 饭太好吃了，我吃多了。

en: I hear you are good at cooking.
zh: 我听说你很会做饭。

en: You are a good cook, aren't you?
zh: 你是个好厨师，不是吗？

en: May I see the rate list.
zh: 我可以看看价目表吗？

en: Show me a list of your rates, please.
zh: 请给我看看你们的价目表。

en: My telephone service was cut off because of unpaid bills.
zh: 我的电话服务因为未付账单而被切断了。

en: Could you charge it to my room?
zh: 你可以把它记在我的房间账上吗？

en: Pay your dues to the treasurer.
zh: 把你的会费交给财务主管。

en: Pay your fare here.
zh: 请在这里付车费。

en: The room charge is 100 USD a night plus tax.
zh: 房间费用是每晚100美元加上税。

en: The room charge is $100 a night plus tax.
zh: 房间费用是每晚100美元加上税。

en: It costs $100 a night not counting tax.
zh: 每晚100美元，不含税。

en: Please find some hotel where the rates are moderate.
zh: 请找一些价格适中的酒店。

en: The price does not include the box.
zh: 价格不包括盒子。

en: Have you got used to living in the dorm?
zh: 你习惯住在宿舍了吗？

en: Have you gotten used to living in the dorm?
zh: 你习惯住在宿舍了吗？

en: The fee includes the payment for professional services needed to complete the survey.
zh: 该费用包括完成调查所需的专业服务费用。

en: Our dorm's heating system isn't working properly.
zh: 我们宿舍的供暖系统不太好。

en: You must observe the rules of the dormitory.
zh: 你必须遵守宿舍的规章制度。

en: A common theme underlies both perspectives.
zh: 一个共同的主题贯穿于两种观点。

en: I don't like both of them.
zh: 我两个都不喜欢。

en: I do not like both of them.
zh: 我两个都不喜欢。

en: They are both good.
zh: 他们两个都很好。

en: Between two stools one falls to the ground.
zh: 脚踏两只船，一事无成。

en: You can't have it both ways.
zh: 你不能两全其美。

en: The two regions differ in religion and culture.
zh: 这两个地区在宗教和文化上有所不同。

en: He scattered the coins of the money-changers and overturned their table.
zh: 他推倒兑换银钱之人的桌子，把他们的钱币撒在地上。

en: Where can I find a place to change money?
zh: 哪里可以兑换货币？

en: Where is the money exchange counter?
zh: 哪里有货币兑换柜台？

en: I'd like to change some money.
zh: 我想兑换一些钱。

en: Keep both feet firmly on the ground.
zh: 脚踏实地。

en: I got bruises on both legs.
zh: 我的两条腿都擦伤了。

en: The girl, like her parents, was very sympathetic.
zh: 这个女孩和她的父母一样，都很有同情心。

en: He had his parents die in the plane accident.
zh: 他的父母在飞机事故中去世了。

en: He lost his parents in a plane accident.
zh: 他在一场飞机事故中失去了父母。

en: Let me introduce my parents to you.
zh: 让我把我的父母介绍给你。

en: Let me introduce you to my parents.
zh: 让我把你介绍给我的父母。

en: The parents couldn't make out what their daughter wanted.
zh: 父母搞不清楚他们的女儿想要什么。

en: My parents enjoy skiing every winter.
zh: 我的父母每年冬天都喜欢滑雪。

en: They are not my real parents.
zh: 他们不是我的亲生父母。

en: My parents rely on my monthly allowance of fifty thousand yen.
zh: 我的父母依靠我每月五万日元的津贴。

en: She is a trial to her parents.
zh: 她让她的父母很伤脑筋。

en: His parents battled to send him to college.
zh: 他的父母努力供他上大学。

en: The parents succeeded in calming him down.
zh: 父母成功地让他平静下来。

en: His parents acted to calm him down.
zh: 他的父母采取行动让他平静下来。

en: Both the parents are still living.
zh: 父母都还健在。

en: Both of my parents are still living.
zh: 我的父母都还健在。

en: Although her parents had said no for a long time, they finally let her go to Europe alone.
zh: 虽然她父母一直拒绝，但最终还是让她独自去了欧洲。

en: The parents want to give their son the best education.
zh: 父母想给他们的儿子最好的教育。

en: The parents named their baby Akira.
zh: 父母给他们的宝宝取名叫阿基拉。

en: The parents try to amuse their baby with a toy.
zh: 父母试图用玩具逗他们的宝宝开心。

en: Parents are responsible for the safety of their children.
zh: 父母对孩子的安全负责。

en: My parents were satisfied with my grades this year.
zh: 我父母对今年我的成绩很满意。

en: My parents object to my opinion.
zh: 我的父母反对我的意见。

en: My parents told me that we should respect the elderly.
zh: 我的父母告诉我我们应该尊敬长辈。

en: My parents told me we should respect the old.
zh: 我的父母告诉我我们应该尊敬老人。

en: My parents told me we should respect the elderly.
zh: 我的父母告诉我我们应该尊敬长辈。

en: My parents objected to my studying abroad.
zh: 我的父母反对我出国留学。

en: My parents would not let me go out with boys.
zh: 我的父母不让我和男孩子们出去玩。

en: My parents approved of my marrying Mary.
zh: 我的父母同意我和玛丽结婚。

en: My parents forbade me to see Tom again.
zh: 我的父母禁止我再见汤姆。

en: My parents didn't allow me to see Tom again.
zh: 我的父母不允许我再见汤姆。

en: My parents prohibited me from seeing Tom again.
zh: 我的父母禁止我再见汤姆。

en: My parents expect me to enter the university.
zh: 我的父母期望我能考上大学。

en: My parents objected to my going there alone.
zh: 我的父母反对我独自去那里。

en: Parents are responsible for their children's education.
zh: 父母对孩子的教育负责。

en: The parents could not help scolding their little child.
zh: 父母忍不住责骂他们的小孩。

en: My parents are old.
zh: 我的父母老了。

en: My parents came to the airport to see me off.
zh: 我的父母来机场送我。

en: My parents have just arrived at the station.
zh: 我的父母刚到车站。

en: My parents live in Kyoto.
zh: 我的父母住在京都。
